question: WHEN YOU SEE THIS SIGN, YOU MUST:

choices.A: Stop completely, check for pedestrians, and cross traffic
choices.B: Slow down without coming to a complete stop
choices.C: Stop completely and wait for a green light
choices.D: Slow down and check for traffic

answer.text: Stop completely, check for pedestrians, and cross traffic

question: THIS IS THE SHAPE AND COLOR OF A __________ SIGN.

choices.C: Yield

answer.text: Yield

question: THIS SIGN MEANS:

choices.C: Yield

answer.text: Do not enter

question: THIS SIGN MEANS:

choices.C: No left turn

answer.text: No U-Turn

question: THIS SIGN MEANS:

choices.C: No right turn

answer.text: No right turn

question: THIS SIGN MEANS:

choices.A: You must turn left or right
choices.C: The road that you are on intersects with a divided highway
choices.D: Designates an overpass above a divided highway

answer.text: The road that you are on intersects with a divided highway

question: YOU NEED TO USE EXTRA CAUTION WHEN DRIVING NEAR A PEDESTRIAN USING A WHITE CANE BECAUSE:

choices.C: They are blind

answer.text: They are blind

question: WHEN DRIVING NEAR A BLIND PEDESTRIAN WHO IS CARRYING A WHITE CANE OR USING A GUIDE DOG, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Slow down and be prepared to stop
choices.C: Proceed normally

answer.text: Slow down and be prepared to stop

question: IF THERE ARE NO SIGNALS AT A RAILROAD CROSSING, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Slow down and prepare to stop if you see or hear a train approaching
choices.B: Proceed as quickly as possible over the tracks
choices.C: Proceed through the crossing at a normal rate

answer.text: Slow down and prepare to stop if you see or hear a train approaching

question: YOU MAY DRIVE AROUND THE GATES AT A RAILROAD CROSSING:

choices.C: When the lights have stopped flashing
choices.D: When other drivers drive around the gates

answer.text: Never

question: IF YOU SEE THIS SIGN ABOVE YOUR LANE, YOU:

choices.A: May not exit the freeway in this lane
choices.B: May continue through the interchange or exit the freeway in this lane
choices.C: May stay in this lane and continue through the interchange
choices.D: Must exit the freeway if you stay in this lane

answer.text: Must exit the freeway if you stay in this lane

question: HIGHWAY AND EXPRESSWAY GUIDE SIGNS ARE:

choices.C: Yellow with black letters

answer.text: Green with white letters

question: THIS SIGN IS USED TO WARN DRIVERS ABOUT:

choices.C: Road curves ahead

answer.text: Road curves ahead

question: THIS SIGN TELLS YOU THAT:

choices.A: No turns are allowed on this road
choices.C: There are a series of curves ahead
choices.D: The road may be slippery when wet

answer.text: There are a series of curves ahead

question: THIS SIGN MEANS:

choices.C: S curved ahead

answer.text: Slippery when wet

question: THIS SIGN INDICATES THAT:

choices.A: There is a steep hill ahead
choices.B: No trucks are allowed on the hill
choices.C: A logging road is ahead
choices.D: There are trucks on the hill

answer.text: There is a steep hill ahead

question: A YELLOW AND BLACK DIAMOND-SHAPED SIGN:

choices.A: Warns you about conditions on or near the road
choices.B: Helps direct you to cities and towns ahead
choices.C: Tells you about traffic laws and regulations
choices.D: Tells you about road construction ahead

answer.text: Warns you about conditions on or near the road

question: THE SIGN WITH THIS SHAPE AND COLOR IS A _____________ SIGN.

choices.C: Railroad crossing

answer.text: No passing zone

question: WHICH OF THESE SIGNS IS USED TO SHOW THE END OF A DIVIDED HIGHWAY?
THIS SIGN IS USED TO WARN DRIVERS ABOUT:

choices.C: Upcoming intersections

answer.text: Lane ends, merge left

question: THIS SIGN SHOWS ONE TYPE OF:

choices.C: Right turn

answer.text: Intersection

question: THIS SIGN SHOWS ONE TYPE OF:

choices.C: Lane change

answer.text: Intersection

question: WHAT SHOULD YOU BE MOST CONCERNED ABOUT WHEN YOU SEE THIS SIGN?

choices.A: Driving with your headlights out of alignment because one side of your car is higher than the other
choices.B: Damaging a tire, if you drift onto the shoulder
choices.C: Hydroplaning, if the shoulder has water on it
choices.D: Losing control of your vehicle, if you drift onto the shoulder, because of a drop off

answer.text: Losing control of your vehicle, if you drift onto the shoulder, because of a drop off

question: WHAT IS THE MEANING OF THIS SIGN?

choices.A: The traffic signal ahead is red
choices.B: The traffic signal ahead is broken
choices.C: The traffic signal ahead is green
choices.D: There is a traffic signal ahead

answer.text: There is a traffic signal ahead

question: THIS SIGN MEANS:

choices.C: One-way street ends

answer.text: Divided highway begins

question: FROM TOP TO BOTTOM, THE FOLLOWING IS THE PROPER ORDER FOR TRAFFIC LIGHTS:

choices.C: Green, red, yellow

answer.text: Red, yellow, green

question: IF A GREEN ARROW TURNS INTO A GREEN LIGHT, YOU:

choices.A: May still turn but you must yield to oncoming traffic
choices.B: May no longer turn and must proceed straight
choices.C: Still have the right of way to turn
choices.D: No longer have to turn the way the arrow indicates

answer.text: May still turn but you must yield to oncoming traffic

question: A STEADY YELLOW LIGHT AT AN INTERSECTION MEANS:

choices.C: Slow down and prepare to stop

answer.text: Slow down and prepare to stop

question: A FLASHING YELLOW ARROW MEANS THAT YOU:

choices.A: Should stop and proceed with the turn when a green arrow appears
choices.B: Should slow down and prepare to stop
choices.C: May turn, but must first yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians
choices.D: Have the right of way to turn

answer.text: May turn, but must first yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians

question: A FLASHING YELLOW LIGHT MEANS THAT YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Slow down and proceed with care
choices.B: Continue through if the way is clear
choices.C: Stop and proceed when a green light appears
choices.D: Stop and proceed when the way is clear

answer.text: Slow down and proceed with care

question: YOU MUST STOP WHEN YOU SEE A:

choices.C: Yellow arrow

answer.text: Flashing red light

question: A STEADY GREEN LIGHT AT AN INTERSECTION MEANS THAT YOU:

choices.A: Must slow down and prepare to stop
choices.B: Must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding
choices.C: May drive through the intersection if the road is clear

answer.text: May drive through the intersection if the road is clear

question: A STEADY YELLOW LIGHT MEANS THAT A _______ LIGHT WILL SOON APPEAR.

choices.C: Steady red

answer.text: Steady red

question: YOU MAY CONTINUE CAREFULLY THROUGH A YELLOW LIGHT IF:

choices.A: There is an emergency vehicle crossing your lane
choices.C: You are turning right

answer.text: You are within the intersection

question: YOU MAY TURN LEFT AT A RED LIGHT IF:

choices.A: There is no traffic coming in the opposite direction
choices.B: You are turning from a two-way street onto a one-way street
choices.C: You are turning from a one-way street onto another one-way street
choices.D: The car in front of you turns left

answer.text: You are turning from a one-way street onto another one-way street

question: IF A TRAFFIC LIGHT IS BROKEN OR NOT FUNCTIONING YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Stop and wait for it to be repaired
choices.B: Stop and wait for a police officer to arrive
choices.C: Continue as if it were a four-way stop sign

answer.text: Continue as if it were a four-way stop sign

question: YOU MAY TURN RIGHT ON RED IF YOU:

choices.A: Stop first and check for traffic and pedestrians
choices.B: Have a right turn red arrow
choices.C: Are in the left lane

answer.text: Stop first and check for traffic and pedestrians

question: WHEN MAKING A RIGHT TURN ON A GREEN LIGHT, YOU MUST:

choices.B: Stop and look for oncoming traffic
choices.C: Yield to pedestrians

answer.text: Yield to pedestrians

question: THE SPEED LIMIT IS _______ MILES PER HOUR WHEN THE YELLOW LIGHTS ARE FLASHING ON THE SCHOOL ZONE SPEED SIGN.
A FLASHING RED LIGHT AT A RAILROAD CROSSING MEANS:

choices.A: Stop, do not proceed until signals are completed
choices.B: Slow down and proceed if clear
choices.C: Proceed with caution

answer.text: Stop, do not proceed until signals are completed

question: THIS GREEN ARROW ON A LANE USE CONTROL SIGNAL MEANS THAT:

choices.B: No traffic is allowed in this lane
choices.C: You have the right-of-way
choices.D: You must merge into this lane

answer.text: You may use this lane

question: THIS SIGN MEANS:

choices.C: School crossing ahead

answer.text: Flagger ahead

question: THIS SIGN MEANS THAT:

choices.A: A community service group is picking up trash along the highway ahead
choices.B: Workers are on or very close to the road in the work zone ahead
choices.C: Children are at play ahead
choices.D: There is a pedestrian crosswalk ahead

answer.text: Workers are on or very close to the road in the work zone ahead

question: WHEN AN ARROW PANEL IN A WORK ZONE SHOWS EITHER OF THE FOLLOWING PATTERNS, IT MEANS:

choices.A: The bulbs on the sign are burned out
choices.C: Changes lanes immediately
choices.D: Tune your radio to a station that gives traffic updates

answer.text: Drive with caution

question: THE CENTER LANE IN THE ILLUSTRATION IS USED FOR:

choices.C: Passing only

answer.text: Left turns only

question: YOU MAY PASS IF THE LINE DIVIDING TWO LANES IS A ___________ LINE.

choices.C: Solid yellow

answer.text: Broken white

question: LANES OF TRAFFIC MOVING IN THE SAME DIRECTION ARE DIVIDED BY ____ LINES.

choices.C: Red

answer.text: White

question: YOU MAY NOT PASS ANOTHER CAR ON EITHER SIDE OF A _______ CENTERLINE.

choices.C: Double solid yellow

answer.text: Double solid yellow

question: YOU MAY CROSS SOLID YELLOW LINES:

choices.A: To pass traffic moving in the same direction
choices.C: At any time

answer.text: When making turns

question: THE ROAD EDGE ON THE RIGHT SIDE IS MARKED BY A ___________ LINE.

choices.C: Solid white

answer.text: Solid white

question: LANES OF TRAFFIC MOVING IN THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION ARE DIVIDED BY ____ LINES.

choices.C: Black

answer.text: Yellow

question: WHEN YOU SEE THIS BLACK AND YELLOW SIGN, IT MEANS:

choices.A: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
choices.B: Detour to the right because of road construction
choices.C: Slow down because the road ahead changes direction at an extreme angle
choices.D: There is a cross road ahead on your right

answer.text: Slow down because the road ahead changes direction at an extreme angle

question: WHEN YOU SEE THIS SIGN, IT MEANS:

choices.A: There is an object on the roadway
choices.B: Traffic is coming from the right
choices.C: The road is curving sharply to the left
choices.D: There is a merge point ahead

answer.text: The road is curving sharply to the left

question: AT AN INTERSECTION CONTROLLED BY A STOP SIGN, IF YOU CANT GET A GOOD VIEW OF CROSS-STREET TRAFFIC WHEN YOU STOP BEHIND THE WHITE TOP BAR PAINTED ON THE PAVEMENT, YOU SHOULD:

choices.C: Put down your windows, listen for traffic, and then proceed
choices.D: Pull forward slowly, check for traffic and pedestrians, and proceed when clear

answer.text: Pull forward slowly, check for traffic and pedestrians, and proceed when clear

question: THE POSTED SPEED LIMITS SHOW:

choices.B: The exact speed at which you must travel to avoid a ticket
choices.C: The maximum safe speed under ideal road and weather conditions
choices.D: The maximum safe speed under all road conditions

answer.text: The maximum safe speed under ideal road and weather conditions

question: A HIGHWAY WITH TWO-WAY TRAFFIC IS MARKED BY WHICH OF THESE SIGNS?
FROM THE CENTER LANE, WHAT MANEUVERS CAN YOU PERFORM?

choices.C: Pass slower-moving traffic

answer.text: Make left turns

question: WHICH OF THESE SIGNS MEANS THAT DRIVERS SHOULD KEEP TO THE RIGHT?
TEENAGE DRIVERS ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE INVOLVED IN A CRASH WHEN:

choices.A: They are driving with their pet as a passenger
choices.B: They are driving with adult passengers
choices.C: They are driving with teenage passengers
choices.D: They are driving without any passengers

answer.text: They are driving with teenage passengers

question: DRIVERS WHO EAT AND DRINK WHILE DRIVING:

choices.C: Are better drivers because they are not hungry

answer.text: Have trouble controlling their vehicles

question: PREPARING TO SMOKE AND SMOKING WHILE DRIVING:

choices.C: Are distracting activities

answer.text: Are distracting activities

question: THE TOP MAJOR CRASH TYPE FOR 16 YEAR OLD DRIVERS IN PENNSYLVANIA IS:

choices.C: Driving in reverse on a side street
choices.D: Driving on the shoulder of a highway

answer.text: Single vehicle/run-off-the-road

question: WHEN PASSING A BICYCLIST, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Blast your horn to alert the bicyclist
choices.B: Move as far left as possible
choices.C: Remain in the center of the lane

answer.text: Move as far left as possible

question: WHEN YOU DRIVE THROUGH AN AREA WHERE CHILDREN ARE PLAYING, YOU SHOULD EXPECT THEM:

choices.A: To know when it is safe to cross
choices.B: To stop at the curb before crossing the street
choices.C: To run out in front of you without looking
choices.D: Not to cross unless they are with an adult

answer.text: To run out in front of you without looking

question: IF YOU ARE DRIVING BEHIND A MOTORCYCLE, YOU MUST:

choices.A: Allow the motorcycle to use a complete lane
choices.B: Drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle
choices.C: Allow the motorcycle to use only half a lane
choices.D: Pass in the same lane where the motorcycle is driving

answer.text: Allow the motorcycle to use a complete lane

question: WHEN TRAVELING BEHIND A MOTORCYCLE:

choices.A: Allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths
choices.B: Allow at least 2 seconds of following distance
choices.C: Allow at least 4 seconds of following distance
choices.D: Allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths

answer.text: Allow at least 4 seconds of following distance

question: YOU NEED TO USE EXTRA CAUTION WHEN DRIVING NEAR A PEDESTRIAN USING A WHITE CANE BECAUSE:

choices.C: They are blind

answer.text: They are blind

question: WHEN DRIVING NEAR A BLIND PEDESTRIAN WHO IS CARRYING A WHITE CANE OR USING A GUIDE DOG, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Slow down and be prepared to stop
choices.C: Proceed normally

answer.text: Slow down and be prepared to stop

question: WHO MUST YIELD WHEN A DRIVER IS TURNING AND A PEDESTRIAN IS CROSSING WITHOUT A TRAFFIC LIGHT?

choices.C: Whoever is slower

answer.text: The driver

question: AN ORANGE TRIANGLE ON THE BACK OF A VEHICLE INDICATES THAT VEHICLE:

choices.C: Travels at slower speeds than normal traffic

answer.text: Travels at slower speeds than normal traffic

question: AT NIGHT, IT IS HARDEST TO SEE:

choices.C: Other motorists

answer.text: Pedestrians

question: WHEN A TRUCK DRIVER BEHIND YOU WANTS TO PASS YOUR VEHICLE, YOUR SPEED SHOULD:

choices.C: Change

answer.text: Remain steady or decrease

question: WHEN SHARING THE ROAD WITH A TRUCK, IT IS IMPORTANT TO REMEMBER THAT, IN GENERAL, TRUCKS:

choices.A: Take longer distances than cars to stop
choices.B: Require less time to pass on a downgrade than cars
choices.C: Require less turning radius than cars
choices.D: Require less time to pass on an incline than cars

answer.text: Take longer distances than cars to stop

question: IF YOU STOP AT A RAILROAD CROSSING WITH MORE THAN ONE TRACK:

choices.A: Wait until you have a clear view of both tracks
choices.B: Stop on the railroad track and watch for another train
choices.C: Go through as soon as the train passes
choices.D: Go through when one of the tracks is free

answer.text: Wait until you have a clear view of both tracks

question: IF YOU ARE FOLLOWING A TRUCK THAT SWINGS LEFT BEFORE MAKING A RIGHT TURN AT AN INTERSECTION, YOU SHOULD REMEMBER THAT IT IS VERY DANGEROUS TO:

choices.A: Try to squeeze between the truck and curb to make a right turn
choices.B: Apply your brakes until the truck has completed the turn
choices.C: Violate the 4 second following distance rule
choices.D: Honk your horn at the truck driver

answer.text: Try to squeeze between the truck and curb to make a right turn

question: THE ONLY TIME YOU DO NOT HAVE TO STOP FOR A SCHOOL BUS WHOSE RED LIGHTS ARE FLASHING AND STOP ARM IS EXTENDED IS WHEN YOU:

choices.A: Are driving on the opposite side of a divided highway
choices.C: See no children present
choices.D: Can safely pass on the left

answer.text: Are driving on the opposite side of a divided highway

question: WHEN A SCHOOL BUS HAS ITS LIGHTS FLASHING AND ITS STOP ARM EXTENDED, YOU MUST:

choices.A: Stop at least 10 feet away from the bus
choices.B: Pass if children have exited the bus
choices.C: Stop if the bus is on the opposite side of a barrier

answer.text: Stop at least 10 feet away from the bus

question: AFTER A TRAIN HAS PASSED, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Check again for approaching trains and proceed with caution
choices.C: Proceed across the tracks

answer.text: Check again for approaching trains and proceed with caution

question: IF YOU NEED TO SLOW DOWN OR STOP WHEN OTHER DRIVERS MAY NOT EXPECT IT, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Quickly tap your brake pedal a few times
choices.C: Look over your shoulder for traffic in your blind spot
choices.D: Get ready to blow your horn

answer.text: Quickly tap your brake pedal a few times

question: WHEN YOU ARE PLANNING TO MAKE A TURN, YOU SHOULD ACTIVATE YOUR TURN SIGNALS:

choices.A: Only if there are other drivers following you
choices.B: Just as the front of your car reaches the intersection
choices.C: 3 to 4 seconds before you reach the intersection
choices.D: 2 car lengths before reaching the intersection

answer.text: 3 to 4 seconds before you reach the intersection

question: BEFORE PASSING ANOTHER VEHICLE YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Flash your headlights to alert the driver
choices.B: Turn on your four-way flashers to warn the driver
choices.C: Give the proper turn signal to show you are changing lanes
choices.D: Sound your horn to get the drivers attention

answer.text: Give the proper turn signal to show you are changing lanes

question: YOUR BLIND SPOT IS THE AREA OF THE ROAD:

choices.A: You cannot see without moving your head
choices.C: You see in your rearview mirror
choices.D: You see in your side mirror

answer.text: You cannot see without moving your head

question: BEFORE PASSING ANOTHER VEHICLE, YOU SHOULD SIGNAL:

choices.C: After changing lanes
choices.D: Early enough so others know your plans

answer.text: Early enough so others know your plans

question: BEFORE CHANGING LANES ON A MULTI-LANE HIGHWAY YOU SHOULD:

choices.C: Reduce your speed
choices.D: Check your mirrors and blind spots

answer.text: Check your mirrors and blind spots

question: WHEN YOU PARK ON THE ROADWAY, YOU SHOULD:

choices.C: Keep your turn signal on

answer.text: Use your four-way flashers

question: BEFORE BACKING UP, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed
choices.C: Open your door to see if it is clear to proceed
choices.D: Turn your head and look through the rear window

answer.text: Turn your head and look through the rear window

question: TO HELP AVOID CRASHES, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Communicate with other drivers on the road
choices.B: Ignore other drivers on the road
choices.C: Drive on side streets and back roads

answer.text: Communicate with other drivers on the road

question: THE DRIVER IS:

choices.C: Turning right

answer.text: Slowing or stopping

question: IF YOUR TURN SIGNALS FAIL, YOU SHOULD USE _____ TO INDICATE YOU ARE TURNING.

choices.C: Hand signals

answer.text: Hand signals

question: WHEN TRAVELING BELOW 40 MILES PER HOUR ON A LIMITED ACCESS HIGHWAY, YOU SHOULD:

choices.C: Sound your horn to warn others

answer.text: Use your four-way flashers

question: YOU SHOULD HONK YOUR HORN WHEN YOU:

choices.C: See a child who is about to run into the street

answer.text: See a child who is about to run into the street

question: YOU MUST USE YOUR HEADLIGHTS WHEN OTHER VEHICLES ARE NOT VISIBLE FROM _____ FEET AWAY.
IF A VEHICLE USING HIGH BEAMS COMES TOWARD YOU, YOU SHOULD:

choices.C: Sound your horn

answer.text: Flash your high beams

question: IF A VEHICLE USING HIGH BEAMS COMES TOWARD YOU, YOU SHOULD LOOK TOWARDS _____ OF THE ROAD.

choices.C: The right side

answer.text: The right side

question: YOU MAY HONK YOUR HORN WHEN YOU:

choices.C: Have lost control of your car

answer.text: Have lost control of your car

question: YOUR BRAKE LIGHTS TELL OTHER DRIVERS THAT YOU:

choices.C: Are changing lanes

answer.text: Are slowing down or stopping

question: BEFORE TURNING, YOU SHOULD:

choices.C: Increase your speed

answer.text: Use your signal

question: THE DRIVER IS:

choices.C: Stopping

answer.text: Turning right

question: THE DRIVER IS:

choices.C: Slowing

answer.text: Turning left

question: IF ANOTHER CAR IS IN DANGER OF HITTING YOU, YOU SHOULD:

choices.C: Use your emergency lights

answer.text: Sound your horn

question: IF YOU BEGIN TO FEEL TIRED WHILE DRIVING, THE BEST THING TO DO IS:

choices.C: Stop driving

answer.text: Stop driving

question: THE EFFECT THAT LACK OF SLEEP HAS ON YOUR SAFE DRIVING ABILITY IS THE SAME AS:

choices.C: The effect that anger has
choices.D: The effect that driving with teenagers has

answer.text: The effect that alcohol has

question: TEENAGERS SHOULD TRY TO GET AT LEAST ___ OF SLEEP EACH NIGHT TO AVOID THE RISK OF DROWSY DRIVING CRASHES.

choices.C: 8 hours

answer.text: 8 hours

question: IF ANOTHER DRIVER CUTS YOU OFF IN TRAFFIC, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Pull next to the driver and yell at him or her
choices.C: Flash your high beams at the driver
choices.D: Get back at the other driver by cutting him or her off

answer.text: Ignore the other driver

question: IF SOMEONE IS DRIVING AGGRESSIVELY BEHIND YOU, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Try to get out of the aggressive drivers way
choices.B: Stare at the driver as they are passing you
choices.C: Speed up as they are passing you

answer.text: Try to get out of the aggressive drivers way

question: FOR AN AVERAGE PERSON, HOW MANY MINUTES DOES THE BODY NEED TO PROCESS THE ALCOHOL IN ONE DRINK?
__________ LIMIT(S) YOUR CONCENTRATION, PERCEPTION, JUDGMENT, AND MEMORY.

choices.A: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit
choices.C: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
choices.D: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05

answer.text: Even the smallest amount of alcohol

question: TAKING DRUGS ALONG WITH ALCOHOL:

choices.A: Increases the risk of causing a crash
choices.B: Is no more dangerous than alcohol by itself
choices.C: Lessens the effect of alcohol on your ability to drive
choices.D: Has no effect on your general driving ability

answer.text: Increases the risk of causing a crash

question: AS ALCOHOL BUILDS UP IN YOUR BLOOD, IT:

choices.C: Begins to metabolize itself more quickly

answer.text: Slows down your reactions

question: IF YOUR BLOOD ALCOHOL LEVEL IS .04, YOU:

choices.A: Are 2 - 7 times more likely to have a crash than a person who has not consumed any
choices.B: Are above the legal blood alcohol limit but fine to drive
choices.C: Can be very sure that you will drive safely
choices.D: Should drink plenty of coffee before getting behind the wheel of your car

answer.text: Are 2 - 7 times more likely to have a crash than a person who has not consumed any

question: WHEN YOU HEAR A FIRE ENGINE SIREN, YOU MUST:

choices.A: Slow down until it passes you
choices.C: Pull over to the side of the road and stop
choices.D: Speed up and take the nearest exit

answer.text: Pull over to the side of the road and stop

question: IF YOU HAVE A TIRE BLOWOUT, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Allow the steering wheel to move freely
choices.B: Let the car slow to a stop
choices.C: Continue driving until you reach a garage
choices.D: Brake hard to stop the car immediately

answer.text: Let the car slow to a stop

question: IF YOUR CAR BREAKS DOWN ON A HIGHWAY, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Sit in your car and wait for help
choices.B: Use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers
choices.C: Sound your horn at passing motorists
choices.D: Flash your headlights at oncoming traffic

answer.text: Use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers

question: WHEN YOU SEE AN EMERGENCY VEHICLE WITH FLASHING LIGHTS, YOU MUST:

choices.A: Slow down and keep moving in your lane
choices.C: Pull to the curb and stop

answer.text: Pull to the curb and stop

question: WHEN DRIVING ON A ONE WAY STREET AND AN EMERGENCY VEHICLE WITH FLASHING LIGHTS IS BEHIND YOUR CAR, YOU:

choices.B: Drive toward the nearest road side and stop
choices.C: Speed up and take the nearest exit
choices.D: Slow down until the vehicle passes you

answer.text: Drive toward the nearest road side and stop

question: AFTER AN EMERGENCY VEHICLE PASSES YOU WITH ITS SIREN ON, YOU MUST:

choices.A: Drive closely to the police car
choices.B: Drive as fast as the police car
choices.C: Avoid driving closer than 500 feet behind the emergency vehicle
choices.D: Drive near the curb very slowly

answer.text: Avoid driving closer than 500 feet behind the emergency vehicle

question: CRASHES IN WORK ZONES ARE MOST COMMONLY THE RESULT OF:

choices.B: Hydroplaning because of water sprayed on the roadway
choices.C: Loss of steering control after driving over wet paint

answer.text: Carelessness and speeding

question: WHEN DRIVING THROUGH A WORK ZONE, IT IS A GOOD SAFETY PRACTICE TO:

choices.A: Drive close to the vehicle in front of you to keep traffic flowing freely
choices.B: Shorten your usual following distance by about half
choices.C: Turn on your cruise control
choices.D: Lengthen your usual following distance by double

answer.text: Lengthen your usual following distance by double

question: ON TWO-LANE, TWO-WAY STREETS OR HIGHWAYS, YOU SHOULD START LEFT TURNS:

choices.C: In the center of the lane

answer.text: Close to the center line

question: TO TURN LEFT ON MULTI-LANE STREETS AND HIGHWAYS, YOU SHOULD START FROM:

choices.C: The left lane

answer.text: The left lane

question: ON A TWO-LANE ROAD, YOU MAY PASS ANOTHER VEHICLE ON THE RIGHT WHEN:

choices.A: Driving on a single lane entrance ramp
choices.B: The driver you are passing is travelling slower than the posted speed limit
choices.C: Never
choices.D: The driver you are passing is making a left turn

answer.text: The driver you are passing is making a left turn

question: TO PASS A SLOWER-MOVING VEHICLE ON A TWO-LANE ROAD YOU MUST:

choices.B: Flash your lights to oncoming traffic
choices.C: Use the shoulder
choices.D: Use that lane that belongs to oncoming traffic

answer.text: Use that lane that belongs to oncoming traffic

question: THESE PAVEMENT MARKINGS TELL YOU THAT AT THE INTERSECTION AHEAD:

choices.A: Center lane traffic may go straight or turn left
choices.B: You can only turn right from the center lane
choices.C: The center lane mergers into one lane
choices.D: Center lane traffic must turn left

answer.text: Center lane traffic may go straight or turn left

question: THE MOST IMPORTANT THING TO REMEMBER ABOUT SPEED MANAGEMENT AND CURVES IS TO:

choices.A: Drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down at the sharpest part of the curve
choices.B: Slow down before you enter the curve
choices.C: Accelerate gently before you enter the curve
choices.D: Drive at the posted speed limit of the roadway, before, throughout, and after the curve

answer.text: Slow down before you enter the curve

question: DRIVERS ENTERING A ROUNDABOUT OR TRAFFIC CIRCLE:

choices.B: Must yield to drivers in the roundabout or traffic circle
choices.C: Have the right of way if they arrive first
choices.D: Have the right of way if there are two lanes

answer.text: Must yield to drivers in the roundabout or traffic circle

question: THE LAW GIVES _______ THE RIGHT OF WAY AT INTERSECTIONS.

choices.C: Drivers going straight

answer.text: No one

question: AT AN INTERSECTION WITH A STOP SIGN, YOU SHOULD STOP AND:

choices.A: Check your rearview mirror for cars tailgating
choices.B: Go when the vehicle ahead of you goes
choices.C: Look right first, then left, then right again
choices.D: Look left first, then right, then left again

answer.text: Look left first, then right, then left again

question: WHEN ENTERING A HIGHWAY FROM AN ENTRANCE RAMP, YOU SHOULD GENERALLY:

choices.A: Enter above the speed of traffic to get ahead
choices.B: Enter slowly to avoid other vehicles
choices.C: Stop first, then slowly enter traffic
choices.D: Accelerate to the speed of traffic

answer.text: Accelerate to the speed of traffic

question: WHEN EXITING A HIGHWAY, YOU SHOULD SLOW DOWN:

choices.A: On the main road, just before the exit lane
choices.B: Once you see the toll booth
choices.C: Once you have moved into the exit lane
choices.D: When you first see the exit sign

answer.text: Once you have moved into the exit lane

question: WHEN DRIVING ON A FREEWAY ENTRANCE RAMP, YOU SHOULD LOOK FOR A GAP IN FREEWAY TRAFFIC BY:

choices.A: Looking in the inside rearview mirror only
choices.B: Looking in the sideview mirror only
choices.C: Looking in both rearview and sideview mirrors
choices.D: Looking in your mirrors and turning your head to look over your shoulder

answer.text: Looking in your mirrors and turning your head to look over your shoulder

question: IF YOU WANT TO GET OFF OF A FREEWAY, BUT YOU MISSED YOUR EXIT, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Go to the next exit, and get off of the freeway there
choices.B: Make a U-turn through the median
choices.C: Pull onto the shoulder and back your car to the exit
choices.D: Flag down a police officer for an escort back to your exit

answer.text: Go to the next exit, and get off of the freeway there

question: YOU ARE WAITING TO TURN LEFT AT A MULTILANE INTERSECTION, AND OPPOSING TRAFFIC IS BLOCKING YOUR VIEW, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Accelerate rapidly when the first lane you need to cross is clear
choices.B: Wait until you can see all the lanes you need to cross before going ahead with your turn
choices.C: Wait for the opposing driver to wave you across the intersection
choices.D: Edge your car into each lane of opposing traffic as soon as it clears

answer.text: Wait until you can see all the lanes you need to cross before going ahead with your turn

question: WHEN NO SIGNS, SIGNALS, OR POLICE TELL YOU WHAT TO DO AT AN INTERSECTION, THE LAW STATES THAT:

choices.A: Drivers on the right must yield to drivers on the left
choices.B: There are no laws stating who must yield
choices.C: Drivers going straight must yield to drivers turning left at the intersection
choices.D: Drivers turning left must yield to drivers going straight through the intersection

answer.text: Drivers turning left must yield to drivers going straight through the intersection

question: HIGHWAY HYPNOSIS IS A DRIVER CONDITION THAT CAN RESULT FROM:

choices.A: Staring at the roadway for long periods of time
choices.C: Too much sleep the night before your trip

answer.text: Staring at the roadway for long periods of time

question: WHEN PASSING ON A MULTI-LANE HIGHWAY:

choices.A: Be sure the passing lane is clear
choices.C: Watch for oncoming traffic
choices.D: There is no need to signal

answer.text: Be sure the passing lane is clear

question: THE FOUR-SECOND RULE REFERS TO HOW ONE SHOULD:

choices.C: Follow another car

answer.text: Follow another car

question: IT IS BEST TO KEEP A SPACE CUSHION:

choices.A: Only in back of your vehicle
choices.B: Only on the left and right side of your vehicle
choices.C: Only in front of the vehicle
choices.D: On all sides of the vehicle

answer.text: On all sides of the vehicle

question: ALLOWING A SPACE CUSHION IS IMPORTANT BECAUSE IT:

choices.B: Allows you time to react to situations
choices.C: Keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace

answer.text: Allows you time to react to situations

question: ALLOW A LARGER SPACE CUSHION WHEN STOPPING:

choices.C: At a stop sign

answer.text: On an up-hill

question: WHEN MAKING A TURN, YOU MUST _____ YOUR SPEED.

choices.C: Vary

answer.text: Reduce

question: WHEN DRIVING IN TRAFFIC, IT IS SAFEST TO:

choices.A: Fluctuate your speed to keep alert
choices.B: Drive faster than the flow of traffic
choices.C: Drive slower than the flow of traffic
choices.D: Drive with the flow of traffic

answer.text: Drive with the flow of traffic

question: THE MAXIMUM SPEED LIMIT IN THIS STATE IS ____ MILES PER HOUR .
DRIVE BELOW THE POSTED SPEED LIMIT WHEN:

choices.A: Anything makes conditions less than perfect
choices.B: Others drive below the speed limit
choices.C: Entering a highway where there are other cars
choices.D: You are on a four lane road

answer.text: Anything makes conditions less than perfect

question: THE AMOUNT OF SPACE YOU NEED TO CROSS TRAFFIC DEPENDS ON THE:

choices.A: Road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic
choices.C: Use of your turn signals

answer.text: Road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic

question: YOUR ABILITY TO STOP IS AFFECTED BY:

choices.C: The time of day

answer.text: The condition of the road

question: WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS TRUE ABOUT THE SPEED AT WHICH YOU TRAVEL?

choices.A: The safe speed to drive depends on many conditions
choices.C: The speed limit is always a safe speed

answer.text: The safe speed to drive depends on many conditions

question: TO PREPARE FOR ANYTHING COMING UP IN THE ROAD AHEAD, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Continually scan the entire road and roadsides
choices.B: Stare straight ahead at all times
choices.C: Drive with your left foot resting lightly on the brake pedal
choices.D: Maintain focus toward the middle of the road

answer.text: Continually scan the entire road and roadsides

question: AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS, ON A DRY ROAD, A SAFE FOLLOWING DISTANCE IS AT LEAST:

choices.A: 3 seconds of following distance from the car ahead of you
choices.B: 2 seconds of following distance from the car ahead of you
choices.C: 4 seconds of following distance from the car ahead of you
choices.D: 2 car lengths of following distance from the car ahead of you

answer.text: 4 seconds of following distance from the car ahead of you

question: WHAT CAN YOU DO TO AVOID THE NEED TO MAKE EMERGENCY (OR PANIC) STOPS WHILE DRIVING IN TRAFFIC?

choices.A: Honk your horn to make others aware of your presence
choices.B: Look ahead and maintain a safe following distance
choices.C: Drive in the right lane only
choices.D: Drive slower than the flow of traffic

answer.text: Look ahead and maintain a safe following distance

question: WHEN FACED WITH ONE ONCOMING CAR TO THE LEFT AND A BICYCLIST TO THE RIGHT, YOU SHOULD:

choices.C: Let the car pass and then pass the bike

answer.text: Let the car pass and then pass the bike

question: IF AN ONCOMING DRIVER IS HEADING TOWARD YOU IN YOUR LANE, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Steer right, blow your horn, and accelerate
choices.B: Steer left, blow your horn, and brake
choices.C: Steer right, blow your horn, and brake
choices.D: Stay in the center of your lane, blow your horn, and brake

answer.text: Steer right, blow your horn, and brake

question: IF THE REAR OF YOUR VEHICLE STARTS TO SKID LEFT, YOU SHOULD:

choices.C: Accelerate

answer.text: Steer left

question: THE MOST EFFECTIVE THING YOU CAN DO TO REDUCE YOUR RISK OF GETTING INJURED OR KILLED IN A TRAFFIC CRASH IS:

choices.B: Limit your driving to week days
choices.C: Stay in the right lane on multi-lane highways
choices.D: Limit your driving to times between 3:00 p.m. and 6:00 p.m.

answer.text: Wear your seat belt

question: WHEN DRIVING ON SLICK ROADS, YOU SHOULD:

choices.C: Accelerate quickly

answer.text: Take turns more slowly

question: WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS TRUE ABOUT DRIVING ON A WET ROADWAY?

choices.A: As you drive faster, your tires become less effective
choices.B: Water does not affect cars with good tires
choices.C: Deeper water is less dangerous
choices.D: As you decrease your speed, the roadway becomes more slippery

answer.text: As you drive faster, your tires become less effective

question: WHEN DRIVING ON SLIPPERY ROADS, YOU SHOULD:

choices.B: Drive as you would on dry roads
choices.C: Increase your following distance

answer.text: Increase your following distance

question: WHEN DRIVING ON WET ROADS, YOU SHOULD:

choices.B: Drive slightly faster than the speed limit
choices.C: Drive 5 to 10 miles below the speed limit
choices.D: Stay close to the vehicle ahead

answer.text: Drive 5 to 10 miles below the speed limit

question: WHEN DRIVING ON WET ROADS, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Increase following distance to 5 or 6 seconds
choices.C: Not be concerned about following distance

answer.text: Increase following distance to 5 or 6 seconds

question: ROADS FREEZE MORE QUICKLY WHEN THEY ARE:

choices.C: In the sun

answer.text: Shaded

question: ROADS BECOME VERY SLIPPERY:

choices.A: When it has been raining for an hour or more
choices.C: For the first 10 to 15 minutes of a rain storm
choices.D: Right after the rain has stopped

answer.text: For the first 10 to 15 minutes of a rain storm

question: HYDROPLANING IS USUALLY CAUSED BY:

choices.C: Sudden turns

answer.text: Excessive speed

question: HYDROPLANING CAN BE HELPED BY DRIVING:

choices.C: Slower

answer.text: Slower

question: WHEN DRIVING IN FOG, YOU SHOULD USE YOUR _________.

choices.C: Parking lights

answer.text: Low beam headlights

question: COMPARED TO DRIVING DURING THE DAY, DRIVING AT NIGHT IS:

choices.C: More dangerous

answer.text: More dangerous

question: ANYTHING THAT REQUIRES YOU TO _______ COULD CAUSE YOU TO CRASH.

choices.A: Take your eyes off the road
choices.B: Take your hands off the wheel
choices.C: Take your attention away from the driving task

answer.text: All of the above

question: DISTRACTED DRIVERS ARE AT A GREATER RISK OF A CRASH WHEN THEY ARE USING WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING:

choices.C: Cell phone

answer.text: All of the above

question: WHEN YOU ARE IN A LINE OF TRAFFIC THAT IS CROSSING A RAILROAD TRACK THAT HAS NO SIGNALS OR GATES:

choices.A: You have the right of way and do not need to check for trains
choices.B: You may pass slower drivers crossing the track
choices.C: You need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping, before you start to cross

answer.text: You need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping, before you start to cross

question: WHEN APPROACHING A STOPPED SCHOOL BUS WITH ITS RED LIGHTS FLASHING AND ITS STOP ARM EXTENDED, YOU MUST:

choices.A: Stop 5 feet away from the bus
choices.B: Stop only if you see children are present
choices.C: Stop and remain stopped until it appears safe to proceed
choices.D: Stop and remain stopped until the red lights stop flashing and the stop arm has been withdrawn

answer.text: Stop and remain stopped until the red lights stop flashing and the stop arm has been withdrawn

question: THE MINIMUM DRINKING AGE IN THIS STATE IS ____ YEARS.
PEOPLE UNDER 16 YEARS OF AGE WHO USE A FALSE IDENTIFICATION CARD TO BUY ALCOHOL WILL:

choices.A: Receive a driving suspension that starts on their 16th birthday
choices.B: Not be able to take the drivers exam until their 21st birthday
choices.C: Receive a driving suspension that starts on their 21st birthday
choices.D: Be sent to an alcohol safety education class

answer.text: Receive a driving suspension that starts on their 16th birthday

question: IF A PERSON UNDER 21 YEARS OLD CONSUMES ALCOHOL, BUT IS NOT DRIVING A MOTOR VEHICLE, THE PENALTY FOR A FIRST OFFENSE IS:

choices.A: A 90-day driver license suspension and up to a $500 fine
choices.C: Sentence to a corrections institution

answer.text: A 90-day driver license suspension and up to a $500 fine

question: PARENTAL CONSENT TO CONDUCT BREATH, BLOOD, AND URINE TESTS IS:

choices.C: Required for people under 16 years old

answer.text: Not required

question: IT IS AGAINST THE LAW FOR ANYONE UNDER THE AGE OF 21 TO ______ ALCOHOL.

choices.C: Consume

answer.text: Consume

question: IT IS AGAINST THE LAW FOR ANYONE UNDER THE AGE OF 21 TO ______ ALCOHOL.

choices.C: Serve

answer.text: Possess

question: IT IS AGAINST THE LAW FOR ANYONE UNDER THE AGE OF 21 TO ______ ALCOHOL.

choices.C: Be in the presence of

answer.text: Transport

question: ONE OF THE PENALTIES FOR DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL IS A(N):

choices.C: Attendance to Alcohol Highway Safety School

answer.text: Attendance to Alcohol Highway Safety School

question: IF YOU ARE ARRESTED FOR DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL AND YOU REFUSE TO TAKE THE BLOOD TEST, YOU WILL RECEIVE A:

choices.B: Sentence of one day in jail
choices.C: Drivers License Suspension

answer.text: Drivers License Suspension

question: IF A POLICE OFFICER REQUIRES YOU TO TAKE A BLOOD, BREATH, OR URINE TEST, YOU:

choices.A: May choose the test you prefer
choices.C: May refuse if underage
choices.D: Must take the test, or your license will be suspended

answer.text: Must take the test, or your license will be suspended

question: FOR A FIRST CONVICTION FOR DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE AT ANY BLOOD ALCOHOL CONCENTRATION LEVEL, YOU COULD:

choices.A: Lose your license for up to 5 years
choices.B: Be required to conduct a public education class on the dangers of drunk driving
choices.C: Be required to drive with a restricted occupational license
choices.D: Pay a fine of at least $300

answer.text: Pay a fine of at least $300

question: IF UNDER 21 YEARS OF AGE YOU ARE CONSIDERED TO BE DRIVING WHILE UNDER THE INFLUENCE IF YOUR BLOOD ALCOHOL LEVEL IS:

choices.C: .05% or higher

answer.text: .02% or higher

question: IF YOU ARE UNDER AGE 21 AND ARE CONVICTED OF DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL, YOU WILL RECEIVE A ____ LICENSE SUSPENSION FOR A FIRST OFFENSE.

choices.C: 6-Month

answer.text: 1-Year

question: IF YOU ARE UNDER AGE 21, AND ARE CONVICTED OF CARRYING A FALSE ID CARD, YOU WILL BE REQUIRED TO PAY A $500 FINE AND YOUR LICENSE WILL BE SUSPENDED FOR 90 DAYS.

choices.A: Only if your blood alcohol content (BAC) is .02% or higher
choices.B: Even if you were not driving
choices.C: Only if you were driving at the time of arrest
choices.D: Only if your blood alcohol content (BAC) is .02% or higher and you were driving at the time of arrest

answer.text: Even if you were not driving

question: THE ZERO TOLERANCE LAW REDUCED THE BLOOD ALCOHOL CONTENT (BAC) FROM .08% TO ____ FOR DRIVERS UNDER 21 TO BE CHARGED WITH DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE.
IF YOU ARE STOPPED BY A POLICE OFFICER, YOU SHOULD:

choices.A: Unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window
choices.B: Get your paperwork ready before the officer reaches your car
choices.C: Stay in your vehicle with your hands on the steering wheel, and wait for the officer to approach you
choices.D: Get out of your car and walk toward the patrol car

answer.text: Stay in your vehicle with your hands on the steering wheel, and wait for the officer to approach you
